ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 302
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi guys, What I do is put about 10 pp in the bank every time I go so I have money to buy if I lose and item if I die. The best way to figure out where you die
ygData.messageBody:
Hi guys,

What I do is put about 10 pp in the bank every time I go so I have money to buy if I lose and item if I die. The best way to figure out where you die at is to try and run to a path or look at your surrpoundings before you die. I walways find that helpful although I never die much :p.

I hope this helps you in your journeys

Reic Rivensbane 27 cleric Morell-Thule

Albain 10 pally




~+~Billy Simmons~+~
>From: "Steven R. Hulse"
>Reply-To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
>To:
>Subject: Re: [EverQuest] Digest Number 302
>Date: Sat, 4 Aug 2001 17:41:35 -0600
>
>Hi Tammy,
> I heard it was 48 in real time hours, (your average daily time).
>
>Getting suff back can depend a little on where you died and if you can find
>youself.
>I died once in some place, (Don't remember know, just finally gave up),
>Couldn't find it and basically had to start over.
>One thing I do is if you can get a couple of good weapons for your character
>is to place one in the bank, that way if you die
>you can go to the bank and get it out so you can go get your corpse. At
>least you'll have some weaponry to defend yourself.
>
>Also if you died at Orc hill or somewhere like that try to group and see if
>they would cover you until you can get all your stuff back.
>
>*******************************************************
>Steven R. Hulse
>Denver, CO.
